head.title: Morton's Revenues Up But Profits Are Weak

hedline.hl1: Morton's Revenues Up But Profits Are Weak

abstract.p: Morton's Restaurant Group Inc reports drop in second-quarter net income, to $2.1 million, compared with last year and 20 percent increase in quarterly revenue, to $58.6 million; reports six-month net income of $5.2 million on 20 percent revenue rise, to $122.2 milion (S)

block.p: Morton's Restaurant Group Inc. of New Hyde Park (NYSE: MRG) reported second-quarter revenues of $58.6 million, up 20 percent from a year earlier. Net income for the second quarter was $2.1 million, or 43 cents per diluted share, compared to $2.3 million, or 37 cents per diluted share, a year earlier.

For the six months ended July 2, net income was $5.2 million, or $1.02 per diluted share. This compares to the comparable 1999 figures of $5.3 million, or 84 cents per diluted share. After an adjustment for one-time expenses to open a new restaurant, net income reported for the 1999 period was $3 million, or 48 cents per diluted share.

Morton's Restaurant Group Inc. of New Hyde Park (NYSE: MRG) reported second-quarter revenues of $58.6 million, up 20 percent from a year earlier. Net income for the second quarter was $2.1 million, or 43 cents per diluted share, compared to $2.3 million, or 37 cents per diluted share, a year earlier.

For the six months ended July 2, net income was $5.2 million, or $1.02 per diluted share. This compares to the comparable 1999 figures of $5.3 million, or 84 cents per diluted share. After an adjustment for one-time expenses to open a new restaurant, net income reported for the 1999 period was $3 million, or 48 cents per diluted share.
Revenues for the six months rose 20 percent, to $122.2 million, from $101.5 million.
